rule.description: Always load and follow ./modern-ai-rules.xml before any code generation step.

project_structure.rule: Separate frontend (Next.js) and backend (FastAPI) into distinct directories: /frontend and /backend
Use environment variables for configuration (e.g., API URLs, secrets) in both frontend (.env.local) and backend (.env)
Maintain clear separation of concerns between client-side and server-side code
Never commit sensitive config files to git; provide example files (e.g., .env.example) instead

frontend_nextjs_react.rule: Use functional components with React Hooks (useState, useEffect, useContext, etc.)
Implement proper error boundaries for graceful error handling
Use Next.js App Router (app directory) for modern routing patterns
Leverage server components by default, use 'use client' directive only when necessary
Implement proper loading states with loading.js and Suspense boundaries
Use Next.js Image component for optimized image loading
Implement proper SEO with metadata exports in each page
Use Tailwind CSS for styling with consistent utility classes throughout the application
Implement proper form validation on the client side
Use environment variables prefixed with NEXT_PUBLIC_ for client-side accessible variables
Write all frontend code in JavaScript, not TypeScript
Create reusable React components for common UI elements (navbar, sidebar, footer, buttons, modals)
Store reusable components in a dedicated /components directory with clear organization

ui_ux_design.rule: Create modern, clean, and professional UI design using Tailwind CSS with clear visual hierarchy
Establish strong typography hierarchy using consistent heading levels (h1-h6) with appropriate font sizes, weights, and spacing
Maintain consistent spacing using Tailwind's spacing scale throughout all components and layouts
Ensure accessible color contrast ratios (WCAG AA compliant) for all text and interactive elements
Use semantic HTML5 elements to reinforce content structure and improve accessibility
Implement responsive design that works seamlessly across all device sizes (mobile, tablet, desktop)
Avoid using emojis in professional interface elements
Include high-quality, optimized images where applicable to enhance visual appeal without compromising performance

backend_fastapi.rule: Use Pydantic models for request/response validation and serialization
Implement proper error handling with HTTPException and custom exception handlers
Use dependency injection for database connections, authentication, and shared logic
Organize routes using APIRouter for modular endpoint management
Structure backend with separate routers for each feature/domain (e.g., /routers/users.py, /routers/posts.py)
Implement proper CORS configuration to allow frontend origin
Use async/await patterns for I/O operations (database, external APIs)
Implement proper logging for debugging and monitoring
Use environment variables for sensitive configuration (database URLs, API keys)
Implement proper authentication and authorization (JWT, OAuth2, etc.)
Document API endpoints with OpenAPI/Swagger automatic documentation
Create a health check endpoint (e.g., /health or /api/health) that returns status and timestamp, and verifies database connectivity

api_communication.rule: Use RESTful API design principles with proper HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
Use consistent JSON response format with proper error messages
Implement API versioning (e.g., /api/v1/) for backward compatibility
Use fetch or axios in frontend for API calls, wrap in try-catch blocks
Implement request/response interceptors for authentication tokens
Handle rate limiting and implement request throttling when necessary

security.rule: Never expose sensitive data or API keys in frontend code
Sanitize user inputs on both frontend and backend
Use prepared statements or ORM to prevent SQL injection
Implement CSRF protection for state-changing operations
Set secure HTTP headers (Content-Security-Policy, X-Frame-Options, etc.)
Implement proper password hashing (bcrypt, argon2) for user credentials
Use secure session management and token expiration

database.rule: Use an ORM like SQLAlchemy or Tortoise ORM for database operations
Implement database migrations for schema version control using Alembic or similar tools
Store database schema definitions separately and maintain migration history
Use connection pooling for efficient database connections
Implement proper indexing for optimized query performance
Never expose raw database errors to the client
Separate database logic from business logic and API route handlers

performance.rule: Implement caching strategies (Redis, in-memory) for frequently accessed data
Use pagination for large data sets in API responses
Implement lazy loading for components and images in frontend
Optimize database queries to avoid N+1 problems
Use Next.js static generation where possible for better performance
Implement proper code splitting in frontend bundle

code_quality.rule: Follow consistent naming conventions (camelCase for JavaScript, snake_case for Python)
Write self-documenting code with clear variable and function names
Keep functions small and focused on single responsibility (max 20-30 lines per function)
Use descriptive function names that clearly indicate their purpose
Include docstrings/comments for all functions explaining purpose, parameters, and return values
Avoid deep nesting - use early returns and guard clauses to flatten code structure
Use meaningful variable names that describe their purpose
Use ESLint and Prettier for frontend code formatting
Use Black and isort for backend Python code formatting
Follow PEP 8 style guidelines for Python code
Add comments for complex logic, not obvious code
Keep dependencies up to date and audit for security vulnerabilities
Avoid global variables - use function parameters and return values to pass data
Separate concerns - database logic, business logic, and presentation logic should be clearly separated

development_workflow.rule: Include a requirements.txt or pyproject.toml file for Python dependencies
Include a package.json file for JavaScript dependencies
Provide clear setup instructions in README.md for both frontend and backend
Include .gitignore files to exclude node_modules, venv, __pycache__, .env files, and build artifacts
Enable hot-reload for development: Next.js dev server auto-reloads on changes, use uvicorn --reload for FastAPI
